translated: the bodhisattvas teach the treatises on medical science out of great compassion in order to perfect sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi bzo'i rig pa slob par byed ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi bzo'i rig pa slob par byed ce na /
translated: Why do the bodhisattvas study the worldly arts and crafts?

original: sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings.

original: nor zang zing rnyed sla bas sems can rnams dad pa bskyed par bya ba rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi bya ba'i dngos po kun shes pas nga rgyal gzhom pa dang / sems can gdul bar bya ba dang / srid pa'i chos thams cad kyis bsgribs pa kun bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nor zang zing rnyed sla bas sems can rnams dad pa bskyed par bya ba rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi bya ba'i dngos po kun shes pas nga rgyal gzhom pa dang / sems can gdul bar bya ba dang / srid pa'i chos thams cad kyis bsgribs pa kun bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate faith in sentient beings by the ease with which they acquire wealth and material things, in order to conquer pride by knowing all the things to be done in the world, in order to train sentient beings, and in order to clear away all obscurations to the dharmas of existence,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bzo'i rig pa slob par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bzo'i rig pa slob par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva trains in the skills of the crafts.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rig pa'i dngos po lnga sngar ma bslabs na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rig pa'i dngos po lnga sngar ma bslabs na /
translated: If the bodhisattva does not train in the five sciences beforehand,

original: nam du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: nam du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par mi nus so //
translated: he will never be able to attain the gnosis of omniscience in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de bas na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to attain unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: rig pa'i dngos po lnga bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i dngos po lnga bslab par bya'o //
translated: he should train in the five sciences.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni drin shes pa dang / drin lan bsab pa ni sems can la bshad pa'i dngos po bshad cing bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni drin shes pa dang / drin lan bsab pa ni sems can la bshad pa'i dngos po bshad cing bstan par bya'o //
translated: knowing and repaying their kindness.

original: ji ltar bshad ce na /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @303a *//🔽thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad ce na / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @303a *// thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: How is it explained?🔽It should be explained with the five knowledges

original: rig pa lnga dang ldan par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa lnga dang ldan par bshad par bya'o //
translated: in order to attain unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: bshad pa la rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: bshad pa la rnam gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of explanations:

original: rim gyis bshad pa dang / yongs su dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis bshad pa dang / yongs su dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: gradual explanation and complete explanation.

original: de la ji ltar na rim gyis bshad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na rim gyis bshad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is gradual explanation?

original: sngar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bshad la /
analyzed: sngar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bshad la /
translated: Previously, the perfection of giving is explained,

original: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: and after that, the perfection of morality up to

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bshad pa dang / drin shes pa dang / drin bsab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bshad pa dang / drin shes pa dang / drin bsab pa'i phyir /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is explained, in order to know and repay their kindness.

original: don yid la byed cing chos bzhin du gnas pa ni rim gyis bshad pa zhes bya'o; ;de la yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: don yid la byed cing chos bzhin du gnas pa ni rim gyis bshad pa zhes bya'o; ;de la yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: “What is explaining in a pure manner?”

original: nyan pa 'dug la bshad pa 'greng na /
analyzed: nyan pa 'dug la bshad pa 'greng na /
translated: If the listener is seated and the expounder is standing,

original: de la bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not explain the Dharma to him.

original: gal te nyan pa chos la skyon tshol lam /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa chos la skyon tshol lam /
translated: If the listener is seeking faults in the Dharma

original: bshad pa la skyon tshol na de la bshad par mi bya'o //🔽gal te nyan pa gang zag la rten gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa la skyon tshol na de la bshad par mi bya'o // gal te nyan pa gang zag la rten gyi /
translated: or seeking faults in the expounder, one should not explain the Dharma to him.

original: chos la mi rten na /
analyzed: chos la mi rten na /
translated: If the listener relies on the person and not on the Dharma,

original: chos la mi rten pas de la bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos la mi rten pas de la bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: and does not rely on the Dharma, one should not explain the Dharma to him.

original: gal te nyan pa yi ge la rten la /🔽don la mi rten na bshad par mi bya ba nas /🔽bkri ba'i don la rten gyi /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa yi ge la rten la / don la mi rten na bshad par mi bya ba nas / bkri ba'i don la rten gyi /
translated: If the listener relies on the words and not on the meaning,🔽one should not explain the Dharma to him.

original: nges pa'i don gyi bar la mi rten na bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi bar la mi rten na bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: If he relies on the provisional meaning and not on the definitive meaning, one should not explain the Dharma to him.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zag de ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su dag pa'i chos la ma gus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag de ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su dag pa'i chos la ma gus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that person has no respect for the pure Dharma of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gal te bshad cing ston pa yang chos la bkur sti @303b byed la /
analyzed: gal te bshad cing ston pa yang chos la bkur sti @303b byed la /
translated: If the one who explains and teaches also respects the Dharma,

original: chos nyan pa gang gus pa'i sems kyis rtse gcig tu nyan cing nga rgyal gyi sems med pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyan pa gang gus pa'i sems kyis rtse gcig tu nyan cing nga rgyal gyi sems med pa ni /
translated: and if the one who listens to the Dharma listens with a respectful mind and without a sense of pride,

original: yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called “explaining in a pure way.”

original: gzhan yang / rim gyis bshad pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rim gyis bshad pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad bshad pa'o //
translated: “Explaining in stages” means explaining everything.

original: thams cad bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽mdo sde bcu gnyis nas tshig gcig gam /🔽tshigs su bcad pa gcig gam /
analyzed: thams cad bshad pa zhes bya ba ni / mdo sde bcu gnyis nas tshig gcig gam / tshigs su bcad pa gcig gam /
translated: “Explaining everything” means🔽explaining from the twelve divisions of the scriptures down to a single word,🔽a single verse,

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi bar du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi bar du bshad pa ste /
translated: or even half a verse.

original: de yang tshig gi sgra dang / don dang / chos su ldan la /
analyzed: de yang tshig gi sgra dang / don dang / chos su ldan la /
translated: That is also endowed with the sound of the words, the meaning, and the Dharma.

original: chos dang / don bstan pa yang spro ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / dga' bar bya ba'i phyir dus su bstan pa dang / dus kha cig tu gshe zhing spyo ba dang / dus kha cig tu drang por thad kar bstan pa dang /
analyzed: chos dang / don bstan pa yang spro ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / dga' bar bya ba'i phyir dus su bstan pa dang / dus kha cig tu gshe zhing spyo ba dang / dus kha cig tu drang por thad kar bstan pa dang /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma and its meaning is for the sake of delighting, encouraging, and pleasing, and so it is taught at the right time. At some times it is taught with scolding and reprimanding, and at some times it is taught straightforwardly.

original: dus kha cig tu dpe rnams bstan te /
analyzed: dus kha cig tu dpe rnams bstan te /
translated: At some times, he teaches by means of analogies.

original: ci dang 'phrod pa bzhin du bstan pa dang / dus kha cig tu de bas nye zhing slab par bstan pa dang / dus kha cig tu ci ltar mos pa bzhin du 'jug sla ba bstan pa na /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i drin shes pa /
analyzed: ci dang 'phrod pa bzhin du bstan pa dang / dus kha cig tu de bas nye zhing slab par bstan pa dang / dus kha cig tu ci ltar mos pa bzhin du 'jug sla ba bstan pa na / byang chub sems dpa'i drin shes pa /
translated: At some times, he teaches the easy practices that are in accord with the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: drin bsab pa la mkhas pa'i mchog chos rim gyis bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drin bsab pa la mkhas pa'i mchog chos rim gyis bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the gradual teaching of the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang / yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Furthermore, the teaching of purification is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dgra sdang pa la byams pa'i sems bsgom ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dgra sdang pa la byams pa'i sems bsgom ste /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva cultivates a mind of loving-kindness toward hostile enemies.

original: byams pa'i sems kyis sems can sdig pa dang bcas pa dang / gang zag bag med pa dang / le lo can dag la /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis sems can sdig pa dang bcas pa dang / gang zag bag med pa dang / le lo can dag la /
translated: With a mind of loving-kindness, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings with faults, to careless and lazy individuals,

original: thabs rnam pa mang po @304a *//
analyzed: thabs rnam pa mang po @304a *//
translated: using many methods.

original: nas chos bstan nas rgyags shing dregs pa dang / gang zag dbul phongs pa'i bar du thabs rnam pa mang pos chos ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: nas chos bstan nas rgyags shing dregs pa dang / gang zag dbul phongs pa'i bar du thabs rnam pa mang pos chos ston par byed kyi /
translated: He teaches the Dharma using many methods, from the proud and arrogant down to poor individuals.

original: bdag bstod pa'am /
analyzed: bdag bstod pa'am /
translated: to praise oneself,

original: gzhan smod pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan smod pa'am /
translated: to disparage others,

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / rnyed pa dang / grags pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / rnyed pa dang / grags pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni /
translated: or for the sake of food, drink, gain, or fame.

original: byang chub sems dpa' drin shes shing drin bsab pa la mkhas pa'i chos yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' drin shes shing drin bsab pa la mkhas pa'i chos yongs su dag par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s pure explanation of the Dharma, skilled in knowing and repaying kindness.

original: de la ji ltar na chos bzhin du gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na chos bzhin du gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “What is it like to abide in accordance with the Dharma?

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dge ba'i chos sgom zhing yongs su dag pa dang ldan te drin shes pa dang / drin bsab pa yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dge ba'i chos sgom zhing yongs su dag pa dang ldan te drin shes pa dang / drin bsab pa yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su bstan pa'o //
translated: It is to cultivate wholesome physical, verbal, and mental actions, to be endowed with purity, and to teach the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of knowing kindness and repaying kindness.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po drin shes shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po drin shes shing /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who knows kindness

original: drin bsab pa ni don yid la byed de /
analyzed: drin bsab pa ni don yid la byed de /
translated: and repays kindness attends to the meaning.

original: mang du thos pas gzungs thob par byed cing chos kyi sgron ma 'bar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mang du thos pas gzungs thob par byed cing chos kyi sgron ma 'bar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Through much learning, he attains dhāraṇī and, in order to make the lamp of the Dharma blaze,

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / mang du thos pa la brtson par bya /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / mang du thos pa la brtson par bya /
translated: For the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to all sentient beings, they strive in generosity, discipline, and learning.

original: chos ston cing 'chad pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya yi chos la skyon mi gdags /
analyzed: chos ston cing 'chad pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya yi chos la skyon mi gdags /
translated: They make offerings and serve those who teach the Dharma and explain it, without criticizing the Dharma.

original: ston cing 'chad pa la skyon mi gdags /
analyzed: ston cing 'chad pa la skyon mi gdags /
translated: They do not criticize those who teach and explain it.

original: gnod pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa'i sems kyis sems can la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa'i sems kyis sems can la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni /
translated: With a mind free from harm and violence, they give sentient beings freedom from fear.

original: drin shes pa @304b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drin shes pa @304b zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “knowing kindness.”

original: lha dang / mi'i longs spyod myong zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam thob pa ni drin shes pa dang / drin bsab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i longs spyod myong zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam thob pa ni drin shes pa dang / drin bsab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Experiencing the enjoyments of gods and humans and attaining the path to nirvāṇa is called “knowing kindness” and “repaying kindness.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas

original: gzhan yang / dngos po bzhis bzod pa bsgom zhing mi bzod pa yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dngos po bzhis bzod pa bsgom zhing mi bzod pa yongs su spangs te /
translated: Furthermore, they cultivate patience and abandon impatience through four things.

original: byang chub brgyan pa'i phyir sems can mang po bsdus nas bzod pa bsgom pa la bkod de /
analyzed: byang chub brgyan pa'i phyir sems can mang po bsdus nas bzod pa bsgom pa la bkod de /
translated: In order to adorn enlightenment, they gather many sentient beings and establish them in the practice of patience.

original: bdag kyang bzod pa byed de /
analyzed: bdag kyang bzod pa byed de /
translated: They themselves practice patience.

original: gzhan yang bzod pa byed pa la 'god cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa byed pa la 'god cing /
translated: Furthermore, they establish others in patience.

original: 'jigs pa dang bral ba ni drin shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bral ba ni drin shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Being free from fear is called “knowing gratitude.”

original: de ltar bzod pa byas pa'i rkyen gyis zhe sdang gi sems mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa byas pa'i rkyen gyis zhe sdang gi sems mi 'byung bas /
translated: Thus, due to the condition of practicing patience, the mind of anger does not arise.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Therefore, they possess an excellent retinue.

original: nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas 'gyod pa'i sems med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas 'gyod pa'i sems med de /
translated: Since suffering and afflictions do not arise, there is no regretful mind.

original: lus 'di dang bral nas kyang lha dang / mi'i longs spyod mya ngan las 'da' ba thob pa ni drin bsab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di dang bral nas kyang lha dang / mi'i longs spyod mya ngan las 'da' ba thob pa ni drin bsab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even after separating from this body, attaining the enjoyments of gods and humans and attaining nirvāṇa is called “repaying kindness.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dngos po rnam pa bzhis brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dngos po rnam pa bzhis brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: furthermore, bodhisattvas practice diligence through four things.

original: le lo yongs su spangs nas byang chub brgyan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: le lo yongs su spangs nas byang chub brgyan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having completely abandoned laziness, in order to adorn enlightenment,

original: sems can yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su sdud do //
translated: they gather sentient beings.

original: byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pas nyal na yang bde la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pas nyal na yang bde la /
translated: Since they practice diligence for the path of enlightenment, they sleep happily

original: sad na yang bde ste /
analyzed: sad na yang bde ste /
translated: and wake up happily.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral bas bde ba'i chos skye zhing 'phel te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral bas bde ba'i chos skye zhing 'phel te /
translated: The Dharma of happiness arises and increases through being free from afflictions.

original: lus kyi bde ba'i longs spyod myong ba ni bdag la phan pa'i don byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba'i longs spyod myong ba ni bdag la phan pa'i don byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Experiencing the enjoyment of physical happiness is called “working for the benefit of oneself.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rtsom yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rtsom yang /
translated: Even when bodhisattvas are making an effort at diligence,

original: sems can la mi 'tshe ste /
analyzed: sems can la mi 'tshe ste /
translated: they do not harm sentient beings.

original: @305a *// 'tshag rdeg dang / gshe ba dang / spyo ba med pa ni /
analyzed: @305a *// 'tshag rdeg dang / gshe ba dang / spyo ba med pa ni /
translated: Not beating, striking, scolding, or reproaching others

original: gzhan la phan pa'i don byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i don byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called “working for the benefit of others.”

original: lus 'di dang bral nas kyang lha dang / mi'i longs spyod myong zhing mthu dang dbang du ldan te /
analyzed: lus 'di dang bral nas kyang lha dang / mi'i longs spyod myong zhing mthu dang dbang du ldan te /
translated: Even after separating from this body, they experience the enjoyments of gods and humans, and they have power and dominion.

original: byang chub kyi lam thob pas 'bras bu chen po thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam thob pas 'bras bu chen po thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Having attained the path to awakening, they will attain the great result.🔽These are called the four things that bodhisattvas make an effort at with diligence.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i dngos po bzhi zhes bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas 'khrug pa'i sems yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i dngos po bzhi zhes bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas 'khrug pa'i sems yongs su spangs te /
translated: “Bodhisattvas who cultivate samādhi completely abandon a disturbed mind.

original: byang chub brgyan pa'i phyir sems can yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: byang chub brgyan pa'i phyir sems can yongs su sdud do //
translated: He gathers beings in order to adorn enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas tshe 'di yang 'jig rten gyi bde ba myong la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas tshe 'di yang 'jig rten gyi bde ba myong la /
translated: He cultivates concentration for the sake of the path to enlightenment, and so in this life he experiences the happiness of the world,

original: lus dang / sems dben zhing zhi ba ni drin lan shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang / sems dben zhing zhi ba ni drin lan shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and his body and mind are secluded and peaceful. This is called “knowing kindness.”

original: de ltar lus dang / sems dben zhing zhi pas sems can la mi 'tshe ba ni drin bsab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang / sems dben zhing zhi pas sems can la mi 'tshe ba ni drin bsab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In this way, because his body and mind are secluded and peaceful, he does not harm beings. This is called “repaying kindness.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus 'di dang bral nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus 'di dang bral nas /
translated: When the bodhisattva leaves this body

original: rnam par dag pa'i lus thob cing bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i longs spyod myong ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lus thob cing bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i longs spyod myong ste /
translated: and obtains a pure body, he experiences the enjoyment of perfect happiness.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba thob pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba thob pa ni /
translated: He attains final nirvāṇa.
